Detailed Description

The class Action provides an abstract user interface action that can appear in GUI-components. In GUI applications many commands can be invoked by e. g. menus, softkeys or push-buttons. Since the same action can be invoked by different GUI-components it is useful to represent a command as an Action to ensure a consistent state of the command and its representation. Every instance of the class Action has a text, may contain a bitmap and may be enabled/disabled. If an action is provided by a dispatcher-pointer when initializing, the dispatcher will be informed by messages when a property has been changed or the action has been executed. It is also possible to execute a member function of the given dispatcher.

The following example shows how usually actions are used within a window: 

class MyWindow : public Window {
    public:
        void Init();

    private:
        Action m_add;
        Action m_delete;
        Action m_rename;
        Action m_close;

        void Add() { ... }
        void Delete() { ... }
        void Rename() { ... }
        void Close() { ... }
}

In the implementation of the method Init the actions are initialized: 

#include "MyWindow.hpp"
...

void MyWindow::Init()
{
    ...
    m_add.Init(this, Tr(L"Add"), (Action:ExecFn)&MyWindow::Add);
    m_delete.Init(this, Tr(L"Delete"), (Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::Delete);
    m_rename.Init(this, Tr(L"Rename"), (Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::Rename);
    m_close.Init(this, Tr(L"Close"), (Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::Close);
    ....
}
So when the action m_add is executed by e. g. selecting a menu entry, the method MyWindow::Add will be executed.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Action::Action (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

Action::Action (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WCHAR *  text,
const BitmapRes *  icon = 0,
BOOLEAN  enabled = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which will be informed about property changes of the action. It is recommended always to specify a dispatcher.
text Text of the action.
icon Icon of the action represented by a bitmap.
enabled Specifies whether the action is enabled. Usually actions which are not enabled may not be executed.

Action::Action (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WString &  text,
ExecFn  exec_fn
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which will be informed about property changes of the action. It is recommended always to specify a dispatcher.
text Text of the action.
exec_fn Pointer to a member function with the signature void Func() of the dispatcher, which should be executed when Action::Execute has been invoked. Example, where an instance of the class MyWindow acts as dispatcher and has the method void MyWindow::AddXxx: 
Action* action = new Action(my_window, Tr(L"Add Xxx"), (Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::AddXxx);

Action::~Action (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN Action::Execute (   )  [virtual]
 

Per default the message ActionExexutedMsg is send to the Dispatcher provided by the constructor or Init. This allows to implement the code for executing e. g. in a Window or an Application. It is also possible to implement the code simply by overwriting this method.

See also:
Window::OnActionExecuted

Reimplemented in ApplicationAction, ContextFeatureItem, FeatureItem, IndicatorItem, PropertyItem, CancelAction, ConfirmAction, SetLanguageAction, SetThemeAction, AbstractToggleAction, CloseWindowAction, OpenContextMenuAction, OpenWindowAction, PbAddPhoneNoAction, PbConfirmAddNoAction, PbCancelAddNoAction, PbDelPhonenoAction, PbChangeNoTypeAction, PbSelectGroupAction, SyncSimAllAction, SyncPhoneAllAction, SyncSimAction, SyncPhoneAction, PbAction, PbSecuredAction, PbAddAction, PbEditDetailAction, PbConfirmEditAction, PbCancelEditAction, PbCallAction, PbDeleteAction, PbDelAllAction, SyncAction, DisplayMemoryAction, AddAllToFdnAction, AddEntryToFdnAction, AddNumberToFdnAction, CopyToPbAction, and SaveNoAction.

ExecFn Action::GetExecFn (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the member function which should be executed, when Action::Execute has been invoked.

ExecFn  exec_fn

Action* action = new Action(my_window, Tr(L"Add Xxx"), (Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::AddXxx);

Reimplemented from Item.

Reimplemented in ContextFeatureItem, FeatureItem, IndicatorItem, PropertyItem, AbstractToggleAction, CheckBoxAction, and RadioButtonAction.

void Action::SetExecFn (  ExecFn  exec_fn  )  [inline]
 

Sets the member function which should be executed, when Action::Execute has been invoked. The member function must be part of the dispatcher which has been assigned to the action. Assuming that an instance of the class MyWindow acts as dispatcher, and has the method void MyWindow::AddXxx, then the member function can be set by: 

action.SetExecFn((Action::ExecFn)&MyWindow::AddXxx)

BOOLEAN Action::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id,
UINT16  object_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from Item.
